snippet: Daniel Akerson, the chief executive, said a number of new products should help G.M. gain traction this year after it posted its lowest United States market share in decades.
abstract: General Motors chief executive Daniel Akerson says number of new products should help company gain traction in 2013 after it posted its lowest United States market share in decades.
lead_paragraph: Daniel Akerson, the chief executive, said a number of new products should help G.M. gain traction this year after it posted its lowest United States market share in decades.

headline.seo: G.M. Chief Expects to Regain Market Share
headline.main: G.M. Chief Expects To Regain Market Share
headline.print_headline: G.M. Chief Expects To Regain Market Share
